frame.name: Electricity
frame.definition:
<def-root>Lexical units in this frame refer to <fen>Electricity</fen>, in particular as a form of energy harnessed for particular uses (such as powering machines). The <fen>Source</fen> of the <fen>Electricity</fen> may also be expressed, or incorporated in the meaning of the LUs.
<ex>A compound to generate <fex name="sou">wind</fex> <fex name="ele"><t>electricity</t></fex> was built on the other side of those mountains.</ex>
<ex>China's <fex name="ele"><t>hydroelectric</t></fex> dam is being built primarily for flood control and energy production.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Electricity
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Electricity</fen> is the physical force that is used as power.
<ex>The Brunswick Electric Membership Corporation supplies <fex name="ele"><t>electricity</t></fex> for sections of Brunswick and Columbus counties.</ex>
<ex><fex name="ele"><t>Power</t></fex>'s out!</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Source
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Source</fen> of the <fen>Electricity</fen>.
<ex>The <t>electrical power</t> <fex name="sou">from the plant</fex> will be fed into the public grid</ex> <ex>And that is part of the reason Italy is now rethinking its ban on <fex name="sou">nuclear</fex> <t>power</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>A characterization of some property of the <fen>Electricity</fen>.
<ex>Finally, electricity pricing will be determined by pooling <fex name="des">cheaper</fex> <t>hydroelectricity</t> with more expensive thermoelectric plants (natural gas).</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Inherent_purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>The intended <fen>Inherent_purpose</fen> of the <fen>Electricity</fen>.
<ex>The government provides free <t>electricity</t> <fex name="Inherent_purpose">for cooking and cleaning only</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: electricity.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the supply of electric current to a building for heating, lighting, etc.

lexUnit.name: electric.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: of, worked by, or producing electricity.

lexUnit.name: power.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: energy that is produced by mechanical, electrical, or other means.

lexUnit.name: electrical.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: concerned with, operating by, or producing electricity.

lexUnit.name: hydroelectric.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: related to the production of electricity by waterpower.

lexUnit.name: hydroelectricity.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: electricity produced by water power.

lexUnit.name: photoelectric.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: characterized by or involving the emission of electrons from a surface by the action of light.

lexUnit.name: photoelectricity.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: electricity created or affected by light.

lexUnit.name: energy.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: power derived from physical or chemical resources to provide light and heat or to work machines.

lexUnit.name: current.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the flow of electrons providing power to electrical devices.
